title: Launceston, Tasmania
summary: Launceston (/ˈlɒnsɛstən/ (listen))[2] is a city in the north of Tasmania, Australia, at the junction of the North Esk and South Esk rivers where they become the Tamar River (kanamaluka). Launceston has a population of 110,472 in the significant urban area[3][4] (2020). Launceston is the second most populous city in Tasmania after the state capital, Hobart,[5][6] As of 2020, Launceston is the 17th[7] largest city in Australia.[8][9] Launceston is third-largest inland city and the ninth-largest non-capital city in Australia. Launceston is the most liveable regional city,[10] and was one of the most popular regional cities to move to in Australia from 2020-21.[11]
